thread.title: Huge explosion flattens buildings in Wirral
thread.title_full: Huge explosion flattens buildings in Wirral

author: Charlotte England
title: Huge explosion flattens buildings in Wirral
text:
Saturday 25 March 2017 22:35 GMT Click to followThe Independent Online 
A huge explosion has flattened at least one building in Wirral. 
Emergency services rushed to the scene in New Ferry, where a furniture shop was reduced to rubble at around 9.15pm, Capital FM reported. 
It is not yet clear if anyone was inside the building at the time, but injured people were seen walking to ambulances, according to the Liverpool Echo , one with a "serious head bandage". 
Merseyside Fire Service said suspected gas explosion had caused a building to collapse. — Pixels In The Sky (@Stemac2010) March 25, 2017 
A spokeswoman for the service confirmed they were dealing with a blast at two buildings covering an area of around 50 metres by 40 metres. 
“They have collapsed in a suspected explosion due to a gas leak,” she said. 
Nearby residents said they had felt the earth shake from the explosion, which left a huge plume of smoke rising into the sky. 
More follows
